RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JANUARY 29, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since January 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5 ,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRUZ IN THE CASTLE took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Grace's Secret approaching the three eighths pole, cleared that one midway on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on well. BONNIE BLUETOOTH veered out at the break then stalked from the three path, bid passing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and dueled for second mid-stretch, though, showed little more. SAX settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and came along for third later yards. GRACE'S SECRET stalked two deep, challenged approaching the three eighths pole but dropped back off the rail midway on the far turn and flattened stride the final sixteenth. PRACTICALLY THERE veered out leaving the gate then saved ground, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MAE SAI PRINCESS raced off the rail on the first turn then faded through the backstretch. SHEMADEMELUCKY ran off at least three quarters of a mile in the post parade then refused to break. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace,pressured 3/8,clear mid turn,held well drvg

ENTRY.NAME: Practically There
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,saved ground,chased 3/8,3p far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sax
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,rail far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Shemademelucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: ran off post parade, refused to break

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Starter Allowance Purse 20700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JULY 29, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 29 Allowed 4 lb s. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION was bumped leaving the gate and saved ground racing well back from early contention, started her bid past the half mile pole and steadily improved from that point, rounded the far turn about the four path then dug in from the head of the lane and got up the final yards. BETCHA BY GOLLY veered out and made contact with Divine Fashion leaving the gate then settled off the pace in the three path, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, took aim in the three path on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and took second the final strides while outfinished for the win. EXTRA CRUNCHY stalked off the rail the first turn, challenged approaching the three eighths pole and took the nod past the five sixteenths, drew clear off the rail midway on the far turn, was steadily encouraged leaving the turn but gave up the lead in late stretch, then nipped from second in the final strides. HIDDEN IDENTITY was shuffled back leaving the gate then saved ground, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little more. SISTER'S DUTY took over approaching the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met past the five sixteenths, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened. HOLY DELITE rounded the first turn in the three path and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Fashion
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,bid past 1/2,4p turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Hidden Identity
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back start,saved ground,chased 3/8,rail turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HUEY DUEY took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to deep stretch. ISRAELI ARMY was squeezed back at the break, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the three path, cleared second mid-stretch and settled for that position. GOLDEN ADAGE veered outward and made contact with Israeli Army leaving the gate then exchanged contact with ROBBEDINTHEBAHAMAS a stride later, gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and relented second toward mid-stretch. The latter exchanged contact with Golden Adage a stride or two from the gate then picked up the chase, rounded the turn near the rail and finished evenly to pass rivals. LIL BUDDY chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little further. KLIMT O'MATIC ducked in and made contact with Israeli Army leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn about the four path. DOG TOWN ALLEN gave chase through the backstretch then weakened toward mid turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Huey Duey
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 19600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE ILLUSIONIST was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn, eased to the four path approaching the head of the lane, dueled for the lead inside the sixteenth pole and drew clear the final yards. FROGGY THE GREMLIN pressured the pace and took the lead two deep approaching the eighth pole but was met inside the sixteenth and relented the final yards. ATLANTIC VAQUERO chased toward the inside, raced close off the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and ran evenly in the lane. REATA'S CASTLE lacked speed down the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four and five paths, left the turn outside and passed rivals under his own initiative. NOW HOOK'EM ducked in leaving the gate and made contact with The Illusionist, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. TRAPPE THE GOLD gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane. BIGZ'S CABANA BOY came away awkwardly but rushed up for the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was met toward the head of the lane and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Atlantic Vaquero
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close off rail turn,eased out 1/8,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased,off rail turn,4p 1/8,up past 1/16,clear late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WEST COAST WILDCAT took over at the rail into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily encouraged to hold on. NINETY PROOF rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and raced in the three path on the far turn, dueled through the stretch for second and was gaining on the waning winner. COWGIRL HOP settled in the three path the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, entered the far turn at the rail but angled to the five path approaching the top of the stretch, dug in to take third the final strides and was gaining on the top two. HERECOMES SCARLETT saved ground close to the early pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened late stretch. MY BEST GIRL rated close in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded in the three path on the far turn. MORE TAJ raced well off the pace in the three path on the first turn then saved ground on the far turn. UNBRIDLED IRISH had a brief early lead then stalked two deep on the opening turn, though, faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Herecomes Scarlett
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: West Coast Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured past 5/16,rail far turn,held on drvng

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: G. Watts Humphrey Jr. & W. S. Farish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Ol der, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 29 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 29 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SENECA ROCKS settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod two deep midway on the far turn, raced clear into the lane and was steadily handled to widen the final sixteenth. ROCK ROSE rated a short lead inside, kept the edge over the challenge of Mygidgetmarie leaving the half mile pole, cleared that one toward the three eighths and came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, but was met at the rail midway on the far turn, dropped back a length into the lane and settled for second best. TIMEISGOLDEN settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn five wide and came along for third mid-stretch. CRICKET WEST settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and passed rivals in the lane. FLAT DISCOUNT saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. DALLAS rounded the opening turn about the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. MYGIDGETMARIE rated close two deep then challenged leaving the half mile pole, dropped back toward the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Discount
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cricket West
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 7/16,3p far turn,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sylvia Bishop Memorial S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 87. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED FILLIES THREE YEAR OLDS. $50 nominations close Wednesday, July 19, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, July 26, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: 122 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at the time of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GREAT SPIRIT stalked off the rail then challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod two deep at the quarter, inched clear approaching the head of the land and was steadily handled to hold on well. LUCKY BLONDE saved ground on the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then angled out into the lane and dueled through the final sixteenth for second. JUBA'S PARADE was a bit reluctant to load and raced in the three path the first turn, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then outfinished for second inside the sixteenth pole. BARBERS POINT rated just off the early pace inside, bid leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, then flattened in the lane. LIGHTNIN RUNNER took a quick lead and rated the early pace inside, came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the quarter, dropped back toward the head of the lane and weakened. MUSIC LASS veered outward and made contact with SPARKLEINYOUREYE leaving the gate then settled two deep on the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole but weakened nearing the far turn. The latter was bumped outward and into KEEP ON SPURRIN leaving the gate, raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. KEEP ON SPURRIN was bumped off stride leaving the gate and settled in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Barbers Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,bid 3/8,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load,3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,3p far turn,outfinished 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SULTRY SALLY H came away awkwardly and made contact with Spunky Zoey then settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead toward the five sixteenths, drew away at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the stretch. TESTED POSITIVE settled off the rail on the first turn, started her bid leaving the turn and steadily improved through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the far turn then dug in to take second later yards. SWEET FACTOR raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch, raced in the three path entering the far turn, left the turn at the rail and relented second later yards. SPUNKY ZOEY was bumped leaving the gate, raced in the five path the first turn and bid toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. PRETTY SPECTACULAR rounded the opening turn about the five path, picked up the chase past the half mile pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and passed rivals outside. BROADWAY PEGGY raced off the early pace inside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. CURLIN'S DOVE surged to a clear early lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths but was met toward the five sixteenths and weakened on the far turn. TWIN CAUSE saved ground and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Peggy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Tested Positive
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 1/2,steady gain,5p far turn,up 2nd later yards
